All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
AddPartController
This is the AddPartController that handles the add part form.
It allows the user to select between the radio buttons of InHouse and Outsourced which will depict which subclass the part will go into.
The form has a save and cancel button.
The save button will add the part into the allParts list and the cancel button will return the user to the main form page.
AddProductController
This is the AddProductController class, and it controls all elements on the add product screen.
It allows the user to enter in data for a new product and to save this information by creating a new Product object.
This screen contains a topProduct table which contains all current available parts in the management system.
The user can select parts from this table and click the add button which will add that part to the associatedPartsTable below.
The user can select an associated part from the associatedPartsTable and click the remove associated part button to remove that part from the table.
The user can then press save button which will save that product to the allProducts array list in the Inventory class, as well as saving all the parts in the associatedPartsTable to the associatedParts array list in the product class.
If the user clicks cancel it will prompt the user that all data entered will be erased without saving and if ok is clicked, the user will be returned to the main form page.
InHouse
This is the InHouse class that is a subclass of superclass Part.
This class sets up a new object with an added integer variable of machineId.
This class is chosen for a new Part when the radio button InHouse is selected.
Inventory
This is the Inventory class and this class holds both the parts and products array lists.
This class implements the methods to add and remove parts and products, search for parts and products, update parts and products, and methods to retrieve the parts and products array lists.
MainApplication
This is the main class and where the program starts.
MainFormController
This is the MainFormController class that implements Initializable which populates both parts and products tables with test data.
This is the starting point of the program and has buttons that lead to all the other forms of the program.
ModifyPartController
This is the ModifyPartController class that will enable the user to modify a selected part's data.
This class can do everything the AddPartController class can do.
Once the user selects a part to modify from the parts table on the main form screen and clicks the modify button, they will be redirected to this screen.
All the text fields will automatically populate with that parts' information.
ModifyProductController
This is the ModifyProductController class that enables the user to modify an existing product's data.
It can do everything the AddProductController class can do, but uses a different method to update the existing products' data.
Once the user selects a product to modify from the parts table on the main form screen and clicks the modify button, they will be redirected to this screen.
All the text fields will automatically populate with that products' information.
Outsourced
This is the Outsourced class that is a subclass of superclass Part.
Part
 
Product
This is the Product class and this class handles all the product's getters and setters.
This class also handles the associated parts for all products.
